alert.note: Alert for Butler; Chase; Harvey; Marion; Sedgwick (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 25 at 3:14PM CDT until October 26 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Central and South Central Kansas, including the following counties, in Central Kansas, Chase and Marion. In South Central Kansas, Butler, Harvey and Sedgwick. * WHEN...Until 1 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - 3 to 5 inches of rain have already fallen across the watch area. Additional rainfall this evening into tonight may cause areas to flood, especially where the heaviest rain fell across the Kansas Turnpike.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
